title: Relationship Descriptor
description: A descriptor that describes a relationship between two schemas, a 'source' and a 'destination'.  This relationship may be directly between the schemas, or between specific properties of the schemas.  Relationship descriptors may be used to describe foreign key relationships between schemas, defining a relational model or star schema.

_id.title: Identifier
_id.description: The unique identifier for the schema descriptor. This property is required when the descriptor is defined outside of the applicable schema, but is optional when applied via 'meta:descriptors'.

_type.title: Type
_type.description: The type of descriptor this object represents.

sourceSchema.title: Source Schema
sourceSchema.description: The source schema this descriptor applies to. This property is required when the descriptor is defined outside of the applicable schema, but is optional when applied via 'meta:descriptors'

sourceProperty.title: Source Property
sourceProperty.description: When present, the property of the source schema to which this descriptor applies. This value is a JSON Pointer, applied to an instance of an object described by `xdm:sourceSchema`.

destinationSchema.title: Destination Schema
destinationSchema.description: The destination schema this descriptor applies to

destinationProperty.title: Destination Property
destinationProperty.description: When present, the property of the destination schema to which this descriptor applies. This value is a JSON Pointer, applied to an instance of an object described by 'xdm:destSchema'

sourceValue.title: Source Value
sourceValue.description: When present, provides additional information about the values in that field. Descriptor producer and consumer should coordinate on how to use this field, e.g. defining rules on formats, values, and operations.
